recipesJson.name: Indigo's The Duke- a clone
recipesJson.author: ChemicalBurnVictim
recipesJson.description: A clone of the juice that got me in to DIY. Didn't realize I didn't have this on ATF. Just dripped a little that I made a little over 3 months ago, and it ages just as well as the real deal. If you've ever had Indigo's juices, you probably loved them. I know I do. This was like my holy grail for DIY, and it didn't come together until I got FE Hongtashan. From all the research I've done trying to clone this, Hongtashan was the missing link. Once I tested it, everything fell right in to place.

reviews.text: Great recipe for tobacco fans or fans of The Duke in general. If you have the ingredients give it a mix. If you don't then pick them up. Both Tobacco Symphony and Hongtashan are great flavors. Don't be fooled by the (black fire) its nothing like FA Black Fire.

been meaning to take the time to rate this for a good long while. this recipe is such a great example of what restrained use of vaguely unknown but great flavors can produce when someone takes the time to experiment with them. it's a lovely deep caramelly tobacco- a dessert tobacco recipe for sure but not lacking in actual tobacco flavor like your standard ry4 stuff. the hongtashan is the star of the show- what an interesting flavor this one- i would have never bought it if not for this recipe and now i've been using it in almost everything. the soft cinnamon is so interesting- and honestly i can and do vape this almost SNV- it's totally good to go after 24hours for sure. but yes it improves with time. A++ recipe, thanks again.
